title.narrative: OUTPUT 2. ACCÈS À L'EAU POTABLE

description.narrative: Output 2016-2017: D'ici Ã fin 2017, au moins 75.000 nouvelles personnes dans des communautÃ©s, les Ã©coles, et les centres de santÃ© ont un accÃ¨s Ã l'eau potable et consomment une eau de bonne qualitÃ©.Output 2014-2015: By the end of 2015, the authorities at communal level in Central Plateau, Centre Nord, Est, Boucle du Mouhoun and Hauts Bassins perform regular monitoring of the implementation of the Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) component of communal development plans and at least 30% of households in these regions consume good quality waterOutput 2011-2013: By the end of 2015, 73 per cent of the population in Plateau Central and 66 per cent of the population in Centre Nord have equitable and permanent access to and manage safe drinking water points., which contributes to Wash And Emergencies, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: D'ici fin 2017, l'UNICEF contribue Ã accroitre l'accÃ¨s Ã l'eau potable et Ã l'assainissement amÃ©liorÃ©e au milieu rural. By 2015, the percentage of the population using a safe water source for drinking water increases from 56 per cent to 76 per cent, and the percentage of households using improved sanitation facilities increases from 10 per cent to 54 per cent.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the improved access to drinking water of 40,700 persons including 21,200 women and girls in schools and communities in the East, North and Sahel Regions, and launched initiatives to improve borehole drilling and management of water points through public-private partnerships in rural areas. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/03/2018
